name: High Voltage Field Effects
description: Understanding how high-voltage electric fields influence materials, ionization, and propulsion.

cards.title: Electrostatic Lift & Ionic Wind Propulsion
cards.description: Exploring how high-voltage fields generate lift and airflow through ion movement.
bulletpoints: Understand how electrostatic repulsion creates lift in lifters and ionocraft by utilizing Coulomb forces: \[ F = \frac{k Q_1 Q_2}{r^2} \]
Analyze ion wind propulsion using drift velocity \( v_d \) and ion mobility \( \mu \) in electric fields: \[ v_d = \mu E \]
Study the influence of electrode configuration on thrust efficiency and optimize spacing for maximum ion acceleration.
cards.summaryText: Review electrostatic lifter thrust, ion drift, and electrode geometries for ionic propulsion.

cards.title: Dielectric Breakdown & Plasma Generation
cards.description: Studying how high-voltage fields ionize gases and create plasma discharges.
bulletpoints: Analyze Paschen's Law, which predicts breakdown voltage \( V \) in gases: \[ V = \frac{B p d}{\ln(A p d) - \ln(\ln(1 + 1/\gamma))} \]
Investigate dielectric materials that enhance energy storage and resist breakdown using permittivity \( \epsilon_r \): \[ C = \frac{\epsilon_r \epsilon_0 A}{d} \]
Learn how to safely generate and control plasma arcs in propulsion and electrostatic shielding applications.
cards.summaryText: Study Paschen breakdown behavior, dielectric limits, and controlled plasma discharge techniques.

cards.title: Electrohydrodynamics & Charge Flow Control
cards.description: Examining the motion of charged particles in high-voltage fields for propulsion and control.
bulletpoints: Explore how charged particles interact with electric fields using the Lorentz force equation: \[ \mathbf{F} = q (\mathbf{E} + \mathbf{v} \times \mathbf{B}) \]
Study practical applications like electrofluidic thrusters, space propulsion, and ionic propulsion systems.
Investigate charge separation effects leading to novel thrust mechanisms using fluid ionization models.
cards.summaryText: Investigate electrohydrodynamic charge transport and propulsion applications driven by Lorentz forces.

cards.title: Capacitive Energy Storage in High-Voltage Systems
cards.description: Understanding how capacitors store and discharge high-voltage energy.
bulletpoints: Analyze energy storage in capacitors with the equation: \[ U = \frac{1}{2} C V^2 \]
Study dielectric breakdown limits in ultra-high voltage capacitors and energy density considerations.
Examine pulsed power applications where rapid energy discharge is needed.
cards.summaryText: Examine high-voltage capacitor energy density, breakdown limits, and pulsed discharge use cases.

cards.title: Electrokinetic Propulsion & Charge Acceleration
cards.description: Using high-voltage fields to accelerate ions and charged particles for propulsion.
bulletpoints: Understand electrokinetic acceleration in electric fields: \[ F = qE \]
Analyze ion thruster performance using specific impulse \( I_{sp} \): \[ I_{sp} = \frac{F}{\dot{m} g_0} \]
Investigate electric field geometries that maximize thrust efficiency and minimize energy losses.
cards.summaryText: Assess electrokinetic thrust equations, specific impulse metrics, and efficient field layouts.

cards.title: High-Voltage Plasma Control & Magnetic Confinement
cards.description: Manipulating plasma dynamics using high-voltage electric and magnetic fields.
bulletpoints: Analyze plasma containment using the equation for gyro-radius: \[ r_g = \frac{m v_\perp}{q B} \]
Study Langmuir probes for measuring plasma density and electron temperature.
Investigate the application of high-voltage fields for plasma stabilization in fusion research.
cards.summaryText: Explore plasma confinement physics, diagnostics, and high-voltage stabilization strategies.

cards.title: High-Voltage Arc Discharge & Lightning Simulation
cards.description: Examining how controlled arc discharges simulate lightning and plasma effects.
bulletpoints: Model arc discharge current using Paschen's breakdown relation and Townsend coefficient.
Analyze the formation of leader channels in high-voltage discharge events.
Investigate the role of streamer propagation in high-energy electrical discharges.
cards.summaryText: Model high-voltage arc initiation, leader development, and streamer-driven discharge dynamics.

cards.title: Corona Discharge & High-Voltage Field Emissions
cards.description: Exploring how high-voltage gradients lead to ionization and charge leakage.
bulletpoints: Understand the formation of corona discharge around conductors using \( E = \frac{V}{r \ln(R/r)} \)
Study methods to suppress corona losses in high-voltage transmission lines.
Investigate how corona discharge enhances air ionization for electrostatic applications.
cards.summaryText: Review corona onset fields, mitigation methods, and ionization benefits in electrostatics.

cards.title: Electrostatic Levitation & Charge Suspension
cards.description: Using static charge to suspend objects against gravitational forces.
bulletpoints: Analyze Coulomb force balance for levitation: \[ mg = \frac{k Q_1 Q_2}{r^2} \]
Study the effects of charge distribution on electrostatic suspension systems.
Examine practical applications in high-voltage field manipulation experiments.
cards.summaryText: Evaluate electrostatic levitation force balances and charge distribution control.

cards.title: Vacuum Arc Thrusters & Electromagnetic Pulses
cards.description: Exploring plasma-based propulsion using vacuum arc discharges.
bulletpoints: Understand how vacuum arc thrusters use cathodic arc spots for plasma acceleration.
Analyze impulse bit performance using plasma expansion models.
Investigate how magnetic nozzles shape and direct plasma flows.
cards.summaryText: Analyze vacuum arc thruster plasma generation, impulse metrics, and magnetic nozzle shaping.
